channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3308] "Porn Has Never Touched This Machine"... [Pic]
[+2643] iPhone 4 announced
item.description: Developing...Check out more from WWDC 2010 in our liveblog!

item.title: [+2590] 74 Democrats sold out to AT&T, Verizon and Comcast
item.description: 74 Democrats signed a joint letter to the FCC supporting internet throttling by Verizon, ATT and Comcast. Throttling lets carriers slow or block internet traffic. This is a clear attack on net neutrality.

item.title: [+2194] Black Man Arrested for 'Trespassing' on Own Property
item.description: Homeowner was blasted with pepper spray, struck with a nightstick; handcuffed, wrapped in a blanket and hauled -- naked -- out of his home, according to a neighbor and what the man says police later told him.

item.title: [+2015] Penis in the Paper Prank Freaks Out Mormons
item.description: Senior journalism majors at the University of Utah spelled some spectacular acrostics in the final issue of their student newspaper, arranging their editorials to say PENIS and Carroll in very large type.

item.title: [+1494] World Of Programming [Infographic]
item.description: This infographic exhibits pioneers in the field of programming, along with the history and current statistics of various programming languages. Also included are some random facts and algorithm diagrams to make the infographic more visually appealing.

item.title: [+1488] Volcanic Lightning [gif]
[+1249] Cops get Green Light to Guess your Speed
item.description: In what has to be one of the biggest violations of common sense and burden of proof in motoring news this year, the Ohio Supreme Court has ruled that officers can visually estimate how fast a person is driving... and give them a ticket for it.

item.title: [+1243] Email and Bacon - This car has everything (PIC)
item.description: It seems that most cars have a feature that introduces email and bacon right at your reach...or something that resembles so.

item.title: [+1234] WTF is HTML5? (Infographic)
item.description: HTML5 is the next major revision of HTML and will be used for many new functions that will benefit web developers and Internet users alike.

item.title: [+1226] xkcd: Book Burning
[+991] BP to Condo Manager: Clean up the oil yourself
item.description: "Obviously, if they're using hazmat people, I should do the same, and I'm not going to take the risk of a lawsuit and use my janitorial service," McIntosh said. "I didn't want to file a claim. All I wanted them to do is clean that little area."

item.title: [+894] Sheriff Tells Montel Williams itâ€™s OK to Fire Up Joint
item.description: While in Maine speaking on behalf of medical marijuana, Montel Williams had to stop talking because of the pain. Then Cumberland County Sheriff Mark Dion said, "Montel, why don't you just take your medicine?"

item.title: [+806] Happy 25th Birthday "Goonies"
item.description: Fans of the 1985 movie "The Goonies" drive to the remote Oregon village where the movie was filmed to celebrate the film's 25th anniversary.

item.title: [+725] Dad 'Tazes' daughter's friend for sending genital pic
item.description: A French Valley father suspected of tying up and using a stun gun on a 23-year-old man who sent his 17-year-old daughter an explicit cell phone picture was charged this week with multiple felonies. Authorities say William Atwood Sr., 45, lured Justin Moore to his home, ordered him to strip down to his boxer shorts and assaulted him before turning

[+642] Make Windows leaner, cleaner and faster
item.description: Here's the shocking truth: dubious default settings, wrong configurations and wasteful processes are sapping many of your PC's valuable resources. And what's to blame? Windows.

item.title: [+628] Building my father's coffin
item.description: In his last years my father, the writer William Manchester, told me, "When I die. I want you children to build my coffin." Heâ€™d gotten the idea sometime in the '70s, when a Wesleyan chemistry professor died, and his sons, following a Catalan custom, spent the night before the funeral building his coffin in their basement. My dad explained...
